Do violent video games cause aggression? I've played through all three Halos, Three out of four Call of Duties (I would've played the fourth, but I don't have a 360. I played Halo 3 on my friends 360, but he doesn't have Call of Duty 4), and it doesn't seem to have an effect on me.
 
 I would just like the following questions to be answered:
 
 1.) Do violent video games cause aggression?
 2.) Where does aggression start? (e.g. First person shooters, Hack-and-slash games, or Grand Theft Auto style games (no, I've never played Grand Theft Auto, nor do I want to)) 
 3.) If it is proven that they do cause aggression, what can be done to minimize the effects?
 
 I'd appriciate any knowledge you can contribute, thanks!

Meh I was a aggressive person to begin with and I think video games helped me control my anger. 
 
 So personally I could only say its been beneficial to me by giving me something to do when I'm angry without actually harming anyone.

 it is not the violence... which causes aggression....
 
 it is the context and content and intent.. of the game itself.
 
 Halo is awesome... isnt it... us against alien hordes?
 
 call to duty... is good guys against bad..
 
 
 which incourages that if your going to be violent, it should be against bad guys.. or aliens..
 
 the problem is...
 
 Grand theft auto... promotes being the bad guy... where you thr bad guy... fights and kills everyone.. and anyone... 
 
 
 
 it is not a problem of aggression... its a problem of influence to make being a bad guy... cool...
 
 there is a new game out... where people can play the part of the Joker in bat man.... 
 
 and as the joker... the player lives the life of a mean guy.. doing bad things..
 
 and the game.. makes those kinds of thoughts cool... when they should not be.
 
 
 
 I really enjoy violent games... when I play the good guy hero.. saving the girl... defeating the bad guy... its all a good influence..
 
 But GTA... and other games... where we play the bad guy.. in my opinion should be banned. (or heavily taxed, to reduce how many bad games are made.)(i.e.. an incentive for game makers.. to make good guy games instead)
 
 
 -Mosheh Thezion

 *frowns* Frankly nothing should be banned. So what if you play the bad guy? FFVII you technically play as a terroist. Granted you're going against an evil corporation but that doesn't change the fact that you're a mercenary ruining other people's lives. 
 
 Besides I happen to enjoy playing Closed first in Jade Empire and Renegade in Mass Effect. 
 
 (I also love playing Megane Katsuya in Kichiku Megane.) As long as someone can differenicate between fantasy and reality nothing should really be banned.

 I really don't understand where you're coming from. I can see if you personally don't want to play games where you're the bad guy. (Which btw a very large portion of games allow you to play bad guys that's what makes it fun). If you don't want to play it don't but don't try to get it banned by saying its a bad influence. Some things are just fun to pretend. Just because I blow up cop cars in GTA doesn't mean I'm going to go crazy in the middle of the street.
Violent video games - - are as boring as the non-violent ones. I simply have better things to do with my time than sit and play a video game. I feel the same way about gambling.
